content: The Moving to Work (MTW) program, established in 1996 by Congress, allows HUD and local PHAs to test new policies for housing assistance programs. Over 30 PHAs are currently participating in MTW, managing around $2.7 billion in Section 8 Housing Choice Vouchers. The program aims to increase cost-effectiveness, promote self-sufficiency, and expand housing options for low-income families. The Moving to Work (MTW) program, established in 1996, allows HUD and local PHAs to test new policies for housing assistance programs. Over 30 PHAs currently participate in MTW, managing $2.7 billion in Section 8 Housing Choice Vouchers and $1.1 billion in public housing funding. The future of MTW is uncertain as the current HUD-PHA agreements are set to expire in 2018.
